means: 渴望，热望( crave的过去式 )

sentence.Network_en: The more gifts she received, the more she craved, until he was living beyond his means.
sentence.Network_cn: 得到的礼物越多，她的胃口就越大，直到他捉襟见肘为止。

sentence.Network_en: A spicy , sharp - tasting radish was exactly what her stomach craved.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正馋着想吃一个香甜可口的红萝卜呢.

PerfectNetExp.abs: the tired man craved for rest ., 那个疲乏的人渴望能休息一会.
when he was young , he craved a college education ., 他在年轻的时候渴望接受大学教育.
The tired boy craved after rest ., 那个疲倦的男孩极想休息.
The thirsty man craved for water ., 那个口渴的人渴望喝水.

entry.def: If you crave something, you want to have it very much.

example.ex: There may be certain times of day when smokers crave their cigarette...
example.tran: 吸烟者可能会在一天中的某些时刻特别想吸烟。

example.ex: You may be craving for some fresh air.
example.tran: 你可能很想呼吸呼吸新鲜空气。

sentences.sentence: "the child could no longer resist taking one of the craved cookies"

auth_sentence.content: People craved the thrill of spying upon genuine sex.

auth_sentence.content: She craved stability, he wanted stimulation.
